page.title: 01LAND BETWEEN ROTHER & ARUN
page.content: The overall impression of the area is of natural beauty, of woodland and river, of quiet rural serenity. Trees are by far the most dominating factor. Within a designated green belt area, modern building is almost non-existant. The boundaries of the hamlets and villages within the area are well-defined with no ribbon development along the inter-connecting roads. Lack of a regular public transport system emphasises the isolation, particularly for the older members of the community. Attempts have been made to overcome this, through the provision of a Community Mini-bus. The population of the villages tend to be over-weighted with retired people, hardly surprising when there is so little work available in the area. Some of the available property is used as a weekend retreat,
